body_html:
Thanks for kicking off this conversation, @syed-ahmed! As you alluded to, we're looking to merge / refactor Caffe2 and ATen tensors, registry, and operators under a new c10 directory. Effectively aten/ will become c10/ (living at pytorch/c10/ or pytorch/caffe2/c10/ - still TBD) and support both PyTorch and Caffe2 frontends.

@syed-ahmed, what is the use case where you need a separate ATen (and hopefully soon c10) build? We're definitely open to this (especially when c10 is mature), but I want to make sure what you're thinking is compatible with this new architectural split. In the meantime, we've stopped syncing to https://github.com/zdevito/ATen/ so it isn't impacted by the large changes coming.

cc @dzhulgakov @ezyang and @smessmer as well.
